dt: {bc}to assign to a place of insignificance or of oblivion {bc}put out of sight or mind
{bc}to assign to an appropriate place or situation on the basis of classification or appraisal
{bc}to submit to someone or something for appropriate action {bc}{sx|delegate||}
{bc}to transfer (a sports team) to a lower ranking division

pt: {sc}commit{/sc} {sc}entrust{/sc} {sc}confide{/sc} {sc}consign{/sc} {sc}relegate{/sc} mean to assign to a person or place for a definite purpose. {sc}commit{/sc} may express the general idea of delivering into another's charge or the special sense of transferring to a superior power or to a special place of custody.
{sc}entrust{/sc} implies committing with trust and confidence.

pt.t: the president is {it}entrusted{/it} with broad powers

pt: {sc}confide{/sc} implies entrusting with great assurance or reliance.

pt.t: {it}confided{/it} complete control of my affairs to my attorney

pt: {sc}consign{/sc} suggests removing from one's control with formality or finality.

pt.t: {it}consigned{/it} the damaging notes to the fire

pt: {sc}relegate{/sc} implies a consigning to a particular class or sphere often with a suggestion of getting rid of.

pt.t: {it}relegated{/it} to an obscure position in the company

et: Latin {it}relegatus{/it}, past participle of {it}relegare{/it}, from {it}re-{/it} + {it}legare{/it} to send with a commission {ma}{mat|legate|}{/ma}
shortdef: to assign to a place of insignificance or of oblivion : put out of sight or mind
